trans-unit.source: Provides methods that allow you to work with XML schema.

The MetaData class provides methods that allow you to generate Web Services Description Language (WSDL) from type information, convert an XML Schema into a code stream, and compile the code stream into an assembly.
This functionality is also present in the [Soapsuds Tool (Soapsuds.exe)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/40f6f8c8-b80c-4e9f-a920-31bcd0cf45c5).
Creates an instance of <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.MetadataServices.MetaData"></xref>.
Compiles a specified code source file into a runtime assembly file.
For additional information on strong names, see [Strong-Named Assemblies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > If a file with the specified name already exists, it is overwritten.
The path to the file that contains the source code.
The location where the new run-time assembly is generated.
The strong name to compile into the new assembly.
Can be <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
Compiles specified code source streams into a run-time assembly file.
For additional information on strong names, see [Strong-Named Assemblies](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > If a file with the specified name already exists, it is overwritten.
A <xref href="System.Collections.ArrayList"></xref> of streams with the source code.
The location where the new run-time assembly is generated.
The strong name to compile into the new run-time assembly.
Can be <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
Converts the specified schema definition into C# proxy source code.
Indicates the type of proxy to generate.

If <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, generates a simple proxy (also known as wrapped proxy) that automatically loads the channels, exposes all the methods of the remote object, and provides access to the channel properties.
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, generates a transparent proxy that exposes all the methods of the remote object.
The directory where the new C# source code files with the proxy are created.
The input stream that contains the schema definition in Web Services Description Language (WSDL) format.
The list of file names for the code streams that are generated.
Note that the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.MetadataServices.MetaData.ConvertSchemaStreamToCodeSourceStream*> method can create multiple source code streams.
Converts the specified schema definition into C# proxy source code for a remote object that is located at the specified URL.
Indicates the type of proxy to generate.

If <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, generates a simple proxy (also known as wrapped proxy) that automatically loads the channels, exposes all the methods of the remote object, and provides access to the channel properties.
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, generates a transparent proxy that exposes all the methods of the remote object.
The directory where the new C# source code files with the proxy are created.
The input stream that contains the schema definition in Web Services Description Language (WSDL) format.
The list of file names for the code streams that are generated.
Note that the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.MetadataServices.MetaData.ConvertSchemaStreamToCodeSourceStream*> method can create multiple source code streams.
The URL where the target remote object that is represented by the new proxy will be located.
Converts the specified schema definition into C# proxy source code for a remote object that is located at the specified URL and in the provided class namespace.
Indicates the type of proxy to generate.

If <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, generates a simple proxy (also known as wrapped proxy) that automatically loads the channels, exposes all the methods of the remote object, and provides access to the channel properties.
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>, generates a transparent proxy that exposes all the methods of the remote object.
The directory where the new C# source code files with the proxy are created.
The input stream containing the schema definition in Web Services Description Language (WSDL) format.
The list of file names for the code streams that are generated.
Note that the ConvertSchemaStreamToCodeSourceStream method can create multiple source code streams.
The URL where the target remote object that is represented by the new proxy will be located.
The namespace of the newly created proxy.
Converts the specified service types to XML schema, and writes it to a file that is specified by name.
A <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.MetadataServices.ServiceType> instance allows you to associate a URL with an object <xref:System.Type>.
> [!NOTE] > If a file with the specified name already exists, it is overwritten.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.MetadataServices.ServiceType"></xref> instances to convert to XML schema.
The type of service description language to use for the XML schema.
The path of the XML file.
Converts the specified object types to XML schema, and writes it to a file that is specified by name.
The object types to convert to XML schema.
The type of service description language to use for the XML schema.
The path of the XML file.
Converts the specified service types to XML schema, and writes it to a specified stream.
A <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.MetadataServices.ServiceType> instance allows you to associate a URL with an object <xref:System.Type>.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.MetadataServices.ServiceType"></xref> instances to convert to XML schema.
The type of service description language to use for the XML schema.
The <xref:System.IO.Stream> that the schema is written to.
Converts the specified object types to XML schema, and writes it to a specified stream.
The object types to convert to XML schema.
The type of service description language to use for the XML schema.
The <xref:System.IO.Stream> that the schema is written to.
Downloads the XML schema from a URL, and writes it to the specified file.
The URL where the XML schema is located.
The path of the file that the schema is written to.
Downloads the XML schema from a URL, and writes it to the specified stream.
The URL where the XML schema is located.
The <xref:System.IO.Stream> that the schema is written to.
Saves the input stream to a file with the specified name.
The stream to write to the specified file.
The file that the input stream is written to.
